qas.question: Name the six largest European ethnic groups in the city?

answers.text: Irish, Italians, Polish, Germans, English, and Greeks

qas.question: Which city has the largest Irish and Italian populations?
What area of the city has a large Italian neighborhood?
Which three areas are high in Irish and Polish?

answers.text: Kensington section, Port Richmond, and Fishtown

qas.question: Which part of the city has a large Jewish area?

context: <a0_0>Irish, Italians, Polish, Germans, English, and Greeks<a0_0/> are the largest ethnic European groups in the city. Philadelphia has the second-largest Irish and Italian populations in the United States, after <a1_0>New York City<a1_0/>. <a2_0>South Philadelphia<a2_0/> remains one of the largest Italian neighborhoods in the country and is home to the Italian Market. The Pennsport neighborhood and Gray's Ferry section of South Philadelphia, home to many Mummer clubs, are well known as Irish neighborhoods. The <a3_0>Kensington section, Port Richmond, and Fishtown<a3_0/> have historically been heavily Irish and Polish. Port Richmond is well known in particular as the center of the Polish immigrant and Polish-American community in Philadelphia, and it remains a common destination for Polish immigrants. Northeast Philadelphia, although known for its Irish and Irish-American population, is also home to a large Jewish and Russian population. <a4_0>Mount Airy<a4_0/> in Northwest Philadelphia also contains a large Jewish community, while nearby Chestnut Hill is historically known as an Anglo-Saxon Protestant stronghold.
